com.soa.transport.http.deploy

Interface WebAppRegistration

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleWebAppRegistration

    public interface WebAppRegistration
    This interface may be used to publish a set of Web resources as a single web application including all servlets, filters, event listeners and static resources. This is a convenience that can help minimize the number of OSGi services, and the deployment time, for large web applications. This interface also accomodates a single root context path that applies to all of the dpeloyed artifacts.

    Currently this is the only mechanism available to publish the context attributes for a web application context. The may be used in conjuntion with other ServletRegistration, FilterRegistration, etc. instances that will be consolidated by the HTTP service that consumes these registrations based on the contect name.

      Get the root context for the application.

      java.util.List getEventListeners()
      Get the event listeners for this web application
      java.util.List getFilters()
      Get the filters for this web application
      java.util.List getResources()
      Get the resources for this web applicatrion

    • Method Detail

      • getServlets

        java.util.List getServlets()
        Get the servlets for this web application
        Returns:
        A List of ServletRegistration instances associated with this application
        See Also:
        ServletRegistration

      • getFilters

        java.util.List getFilters()
        Get the filters for this web application
        Returns:
        A List of FilterRegistration instances associated with this application
        See Also:
        FilterRegistration

      • getEventListeners

        java.util.List getEventListeners()
        Get the event listeners for this web application
        Returns:
        A List of java.util.EventListener instances associated with this application
        See Also:
        EventListener

      • getResources

        java.util.List getResources()
        Get the resources for this web applicatrion
        Returns:
        A List of ResourceRegistration instances.

      • getContextAttributes

        java.util.Map getContextAttributes()
        Get the (servlet) context attributes.
        Returns:
        A Map containing the context attributes

      • getContextInitParams

        java.util.Map getContextInitParams()
        Get the (servlet) context init params.
        Returns:
        A Map containing the context init params

      • getContext

        java.lang.String getContext()
        Get the root context for the application. This provides the root path for all artifacts associated with the application.
        Returns:
        The root context path for the application. This may return null in which case "/" will be used. Note that this may in turn have a prefix added based on the container that the HTTP service ultimately deploys the application into.
